Hi! I’m Peter, a forty-something years old engineer with electronics manufacturing background. As a hobby, I’m interested in cyber security and just started bug bounty hunting. Let’s see where it goes - it could be a potential side income, or help a career change to cyber sec.
This is my collection of how-to notes, tutorials, learning resources about IT security, Linux, Python etc. It is primarily for me, so don’t expect long posts describing everything. But, if you find something useful here, enjoy using it - on your own risk :) Also, I do this to:
track my suffering learning progress in bug bounty hunting (starting almost from zero) get some experience with Hugo and GitHub practice writing in english Note that this is not a repo with a list of materials for “how to start in IT security” or “how to start in Bug Bounty” - there are way better sites/repositories for this, for example:
nahamsec 1ndianl33t s0md3v Happy hacking :)
title: Hello World!

content:
Hugo <3 GitHub Pages With Hugo, I was able to quickly deploy a functional website with plenty of themes to select from. Hugo is somewhere between you build up a site from HTML+CSS+JS by hand and a fully hosted site, where your only job is to edit content in some online Markdown editor. With this setup, you can manually change theme settings or the structure of your content, play with git - if you want. If you’re satisfied with the look of your site, you can just push content to it.
The pages you would need the most to start with David Saltares - Easily deploy your Hugo site to Github Pages Official Hugo Quickstart Short list of steps: Creat d0rksec.github.io repo (public, with readme.md)
Creat d0rksec.github.io-dev repo (private, with readme.md)
Clone d0rksec.github.io-dev repo to computer (for example, into /stuff)
git clone https://github.com/d0rksec/d0rksec.github.io-dev.git Populate /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/ with a blank site (following steps on local computer):
Install Hugo (.deb worked well, had permission issues with snap package)
Create a blank site
hugo new site /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/ --force Generate a public/private key pair for publishing
ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "<email>" -f publish_key -P "" On GitHub, add deploy key for d0rksec.github.io and paste contents of publish_key.pub
On GitHub, add new secret to d0rksec.github.io-dev as ACTIONS_DEPLOY_KEY and paste contents of publish_key
Create /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/.gitignore
Install theme (PaperMod) as submodule
cd /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev git submodule add --depth=1 https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod.git themes/PaperMod git submodule update --init --recursive Copy favicon files into /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/static/
Create /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/content/archives.md
Create /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/content/search.md
Create /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/.github/workflows/deploy.yml
After hugo server -D, check https://localhost:1313 how the site looks like
In /stuff/d0rksec.github.io-dev/
git add --all git commit -m "site created" git push -u origin main Cross fingers and check https://github.com/d0rksec/d0rksec.github.io/actions
My deploy.yml is: name: Build and deploy on: push: branches: - main jobs: build: # setup virtual environment runs-on: ubuntu-latest # steps to take when deploying steps: # checkout website source - name: Checkout uses: actions/checkout@v3 with: submodules: true fetch-depth: 0 # setup Hugo - name: Setup Hugo uses: peaceiris/actions-hugo@v2 with: extended: true # build the site - name: Build run: hugo --minify # deploy the site - name: Deploy uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3 with: external_repository: d0rksec/d0rksec.github.io deploy_key: ${{ secrets.ACTIONS_DEPLOY_KEY }} github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} publish_branch: main publish_dir: ./public My .gitignore is: # Generated files by hugo /public/ /resources/_gen/ My config.toml is: baseURL = "https://d0rksec.github.io/" languageCode = "en-us" title = "d0rksec" theme = "PaperMod" paginate = 8 [outputs] home = [ "HTML", "RSS", "JSON" ] [params] ShowReadingTime = true ShowShareButtons = true [params.fuseOpts] isCaseSensitive = false shouldSort = true location = 0 distance = 1_000 threshold = 0.4 minMatchCharLength = 0 keys = [ "title", "permalink", "summary", "content" ] [params.homeInfoParams] Title = "Hi there!" Content = """ Resources of a complete beginner bug bounty hunter - me. """ [[params.socialIcons]] name = "Twitter" url = "https://twitter.com/d0rksec" [[params.socialIcons]] name = "GitHub" url = "https://github.com/d0rksec" [taxonomies] category = "categories" tag = "tags" # series = "series" [menu] [[menu.main]] identifier = "categories" name = "categories" url = "/categories/" weight = 10 [[menu.main]] identifier = "tags" name = "tags" url = "/tags/" weight = 20 [[menu.main]] identifier = "search" name = "search" url = "/search/" weight = 30 [[menu.main]] identifier = "archives" name = "archives" url = "/archives/" weight = 40 [privacy] [privacy.twitter] disable = false enableDNT = true simple = false My archives.md is: --- title: "Archive" # in any language you want layout: "archives" # is necessary url: "/archives/" summary: "archives" --- My search.md is: --- title: "Search" # in any language you want layout: "search" # is necessary url: "/search" summary: "search" --- Useful links: https://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/ https://saltares.com/easily-deploy-your-hugo-site-to-github-pages/ https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod/wiki/Installation https://github.com/peaceiris/actions-gh-pages https://muhannad0.github.io/post/using-github-actions-to-deploy-my-blog/ https://medium.com/@asishrs/automate-your-github-pages-deployment-using-hugo-and-actions-518b959a51f9
title: Hugo 101 - deploy to GitHub Pages
